description: [The Point] The Africa-UAE Economic Forum in Dubai on Thursday 18th and Saturday 20th December 2025, convened at a critical moment in Africa's economic trajectory. With capital seeking stability, predictability, and credible legal protection, the forum offered an opportunity to confront one of the most persistent barriers to investment in Africa i.e. the perception that the continent lacks secure and reliable legal frameworks for foreign investment.
title: Africa: Reflections From the Africa-United Arab Emirates Economic Forum On a Secure Legal Framework for Investment in Africa

description: [Leadership] The National Agency for Food and Drug Administration and Control (NAFDAC) has approved the Toumai robotic surgical system for clinical use.
title: West Africa: NAFDAC Okays First Robotic Surgical Platform in West Africa

description: [This Day] Abuja -- United Nations Secretary-General António Guterres has warned the world is at a critical turning point, urging global leaders to redirect priorities from war to peace as military spending reaches unprecedented levels.
title: Africa: UN Secretary-General Urges Global Reset As Military Spending Hits Record High

description: [CAF] Tunisia qualify as Tanzania keep knockout hopes alive DR Congo face Botswana, Benin meet Senegal All the action from the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025
title: Africa: Senegal Conclude Group D With Comfortable Win Over Benin As Both Progress to Round of 16

description: [Capital FM] Nairobi -- The African Union has endorsed a peace initiative presented by Sudan's transitional authorities to the United Nations Security Council, amid a protracted and devastating war between rival military generals whose power struggle has torn the country apart since 2023.
title: Africa: AU Endorses Sudan Peace Initiative Presented to UN Security Council

description: [Cosafa] South Africa advanced to the Round of 16 of the TotalEnergies CAF Africa Cup of Nations Morocco 2025, while Angola must wait to see if they will joint them in the next stage as one of the four best third-placed sides.
title: Africa: South Africa Through, Angola Must Wait, Zambia, Zimbabwe and Comoros Out
